txt.en: All the hobbits have been spoken to.  You should check in with the Gaffer once more.
'Oh why hello there! \n\n'The Gaffer sent you along to me to hear what happened to old Mister Baggins then did he?  We'll I've got a right fine story to tell you, I do indeed.'

'So you're here to collect stories about Bilbo Baggins, are you?  Heard that I would know who to talk to?  Naturally, you're correct.  Give me a moment and I'll write you down a list of likely hobbits to speak to.\n\n'Mind you, you'll need to catch them at just the right time. If they don't seem to have a story for you, check back on them in a while.  If you want to hear every story, you'll need to have some perseverance!'
The Gaffer has given you a note
The Gaffer has given you a useful note
Gaffer Gamgee is sure to know which hobbits have the best stories to tell of Bilbo's disappearance and his adventures and whereabouts since then.

'That note makes sense then?

'Were I you, I'd probably start by talking to Ted Sandyman.   Just follow this road out to the east and then turn south.  Ted's standing just south of the Bywater Bridge.

'I know Ted's got time now, so he'll be happy to share his story.  Just remember that not every hobbit on that list will have a story to share whenever you please!  Just check back on them from time to time, you'll catch them at a good time soon enough I'm sure.'
Speak to the Gaffer, he probably knows who you should talk to first.
'Right then, here's that list.  You'll want to give it a quick look to make sure you can read my handwriting.'
Speak to the Gaffer to obtain his list of hobbits likely to have stories worth collecting.

Follow this road from the Gaffer's out to the east and then turn south.  Ted's standing just south of the Bywater Bridge.\n\nSpeak to Ted Sandyman to hear the first of the stories about Bilbo and his adventures.
Listen to the remainder of the hobbits' stories.
'You managed to speak to all the hobbits on my list then? Wonderful!\n\n'If that's given you what you need, off with you then.  Time to take these stories to their final recipient!'
